segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and I feel a little sad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even seem to notice the puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being sneaky, and it’s kind of sweet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching for cookies, and the stool looks so unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her turn, and it’s almost peaceful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a quiet moment before something goes wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the kids are careful and don’t get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the floor, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR
